page.title: 08THE RIVER SEVERN
page.content: Although the area under study has only a small section of the{River Severn, the{river's influence}on the Berkeley Vale region cannot be ignored. It has always been a major{commercial {waterway}supplying the needs of the local community. Physically the{Severn Estuary}is intersting for having the second highest{tidal rise and fall}in the world and for its frequent{bores}which attract tourists from all over the world. Locally the river has a{navigable {channel}near to the Berkeley shore with depths ranging from ankle deep (0.05m) to 12m deep. The highest water marks occuring during the{Spring {tides.}The river water is used as a {coolant}in{Berkeley Power Station.}It is also used as a{fishing}area.
